comments.body: Do clusters created without publicly_accessible being set have this key? (just wondering whether it should be `node.get('PublicIPAddress')`)

yes - I ran it with publicly_accessible `yes`, `no`, and undefined, and the node always has a `PublicIPAddress` key. Interestingly, even if the cluster is not publicly accessible, AWS assigns it a public IP address value - not sure why.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +251,255 @@        if node['NodeRole'] in ('SHARED', 'LEADER'):
            facts['private_ip_address'] = node['PrivateIPAddress']
            facts['public_ip_address'] = node['PublicIPAddress']
            break

comments.body: yes - my testing (with publicly_accessible yes/no or undefined) indicates the `Endpoint` key is always present.

I'm not sure why an error describing the cluster leads to trying to modify the cluster. What is the exception expected [here](https://github.com/ansible/ansible/pull/37052/files#diff-fd4728adea42973936ca9bdb0082deadR409)?
Should you default these values to None that way the returned keys are always the same? It would also be good to add this note to the return docs for these four.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +247,251 @@            break

    # Some parameters are not ready instantly if you don't wait for available
    # cluster status
    facts['create_time'] = None
